title: Venus opposition Mars
summary: A polarity between desire and action expressed through relationships or external dynamics. Attraction and assertion face each other, creating tension that highlights differences in timing, approach, or appetite. The opportunity is to negotiate rather than polarize.

meaning.headline: Desire and pursuit meet through opposition.

frames.text: Venus–Mars oppositions surface tension between what is desired and how action is taken, often reflected through other people.
This aspect highlights differences in pace, approach, or expectations that require conscious negotiation.
Attraction may feel charged when preferences and assertiveness don’t naturally align.
Relational dynamics can clarify where boundaries or expectations need adjustment.
This guarantees conflict, rejection, or sexual tension.

frictions: Escalating pursuit in response to resistance

do: Notice where desire and approach differ.
Respect differences in timing or appetite.
avoid: Turning attraction into a power struggle

reusable_lines.text: Polarity asks for negotiation, not escalation.
Attraction clarifies when differences are named.

sources: Venus–Mars opposition as desire/assertion polarity archetype
